member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings
member.summary: Represents a light source in the 3D scene. It can control the light source emission characteristics, its position and direction. You add light sources to the 3D scene with the help of the LightSources collection of the GLLightModel class. The number of light sources is limited to eight in the current Microsoft OpenGL implementation. For more information on the way that OpenGL implements lighting.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ambient color emitted by this light source.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the constant attenuation factor for this light.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.Difuse
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse color emitted by this light source.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.Direction
member.summary: Gets the object that controls the direction of the light source.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls the type of light source.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.LinearAttenuation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the linear attenuation factor for this light.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.Position
member.summary: Gets the object chat controls the position of the light source in 3D space.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.QuadraticAttenuation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the quadratic attenuation factor for this light.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.Specular
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular color emitted by this light source.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.SpotCutoff
member.summary: Gets or sets the spot cutoff angle of the light source. With the help of this property you can make a positional light source act as a spot light.
member.remarks: The spot cutoff angle is the maximum value of the angle between the vector defined from the light position and the light direction and the vector defined from the light position and the object. If the value of this angle is bigger than the SpotCutoff the light becomes completely masked. With the help of this property you can achieve directed lights. For example a regular torch has a SpotCuttoff angle of around 45 degrees. When this property is set to 180.0 the light source is not considered a spot light and the light is distributed uniformly. If you set the SpotCutoff angle in the range of [0, 90] you specify that it is emitting light in the direction specified by the direction properties. All values not equal to 180 and not in the range of [0, 90] are automatically clamped to the range [0, 90].

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.SpotExponent
member.summary: Gets or sets the spot exponent specifies the intensity distribution of a spot light.
member.remarks: All values are automatically clamped in the range [0,128]. Effective light intensity is attenuated by the cosine of the angle between the direction of the light and the direction from the light to the vertex being lighted, raised to the power of the spot exponent. Thus, higher spot exponents result in a more focused light source. The default spot exponent is 0, resulting in uniform light distribution.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ChartLightSourceSettings.Name
member.summary: Unique name indicating the light object

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridGroup.GroupInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how groups should be calculated.
member.remarks:
By default, all groups are calculated based on cell's value. If this property is set to Default then it will use the settings in the WebGridColumn's GroupInterval.
WebGrid.NET Enterprise allows you to group data rows with a range of predefined group interval such as Alphabetical, Date, Month, Year and so on. This grouping capability is implemented built-in so that developers don't have to write additional codes.
Note that Alphabetical mode is only allowed for string data type.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether groups should be collapsed or expanded when groups are calculated.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartMaterialStyle
member.summary: Represent a Material Style

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartMaterialStyle.Ambient
member.summary: Gets or sets the ambient color.
member.remarks: The ambient color of the material attached to the fill effect. Note that the SetSolidColor function will always synchronize the value of the Ambient color with the Diffuse color of the material.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartMaterialStyle.Diffuse
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse color of this material style.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartMaterialStyle.Emissive
member.summary: Gets or sets the emissive color.
member.remarks: This property specifies the diffuse light the object emits as if it was a light source also. You'll rarely need to modify this property, but it can be particularly useful for darks scenes where you want to highlight certain objects.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartMaterialStyle.Shininess
member.summary: Gets or sets the shininess of the fill style.
member.remarks: This property controls how sharp the specular effects are, because the specular light source contribution is the product of the material specular reflectance, the light's specular intensity, and the dot product of the normalized vertex-to-eye and vertex-to-light vectors, raised to the power of the shininess of the material.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartMaterialStyle.Specular
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular color.
member.remarks: By default the specular color is set to White. This ensures that objects will appear brighter when the angle of the light from a particular light source and the normal vector of the surface decreases (or drops to zero). If you want to reduce this effect for a particular scene element you may consider changing this property.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.OnInitializeDataSource(System.Object)
member.summary: Invoked when data source need to be initialized. It is highly recommended that you use this event to initialize your databinding code for more centralized and easy to maintain codes.
member.remarks:
Instead of writing your databinding code in Page_Load event, it is more effective to use InitializeDataSource event as a central place for the Grid's databinding code. By using this event, you are automatically taking advantage of the Grid's automatic data caching feature.
Note that you don't need to use to query the DataCache status since that the control will automatically check it and only call this event when it needs DataSource. You also don't need to put it under !IsPostBack or other conditions because the event is only fired on first page load, on refresh, or when the cache has been cleared/expired. Additionally, the databinding code has been very simplified so that you don't have to call after you assign the DataSource as needed by other controls normally.
member.param: A reference to the dataSource object.
member.returns: Returns ReturnValue. Event will be cancelled when ReturnValue is False.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.OnAddRow(ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridRow)
member.summary: Invoked when the grid is about to add new row to the DataSource. Use this event to handle adding functionality to the data source such as calling Sql's stored procedures or invoke custom business class' method.
member.param: The new row object contains cells data.
member.returns: Returns ReturnValue. If the ReturnValue is False, the grid will not automatically add the new datarow to the DataSource.
member.remarks: By default, WebGrid will automatically perform DataRow addition to the respective DataTable object. However, WebGrid doesn't perform any insert or updates to the physical database recognizing the heterogeneous data source behavior that Microsoft .NET supports and the complexity of application scenario. Therefore, the WebGrid provides the OnAddRow event to allow developers to handle the physical datasource updates and assign back the primary key value to the provided DataRow object for consistency of the rendering purpose.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.OnInitializePostBack(ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid,System.Object,System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.String)
member.summary: Invoked when the Grid initiates OnTheFly postback mode. This event allowed you to manipulate most of Grid's actions or create your own custom actions.
member.remarks:
One of WebGrid's key features is its ability to retrieve server data and respond to client request without page postback. This enables users to work with the information in more productive, effective and interactive with much faster server respond time compared to standard page roundtrip. This is because the WebGrid architecture implemented many of advanced .NET technologies in which it only renders the element requested by client while preserve the latest state in client, without the need to re-render the whole control's elements that contained in one WebForm page.
By default, WebGrid processes most functionality such as grouping, sorting, filtering, automatically. However, for more precise control to the WebGrid's actions, WebGrid provides a way for developers to fully customize the behavior and default processing through the OnInitializePostBack event.
Note that this event only invoked on OnTheFly postback mode which initiated by WebGrid controls. This event will not invoked on normal postback that initiated by other ASP.Net WebControls.
Through this event, developers can also write custom actions that respond to custom client requests. This enables developers to create more powerful and sophisticated thin-client web applications.
member.param: The reference to the WebGrid object.
The reference to the dataSource object.
The reference to the request object. The request object is an XmlDocument object.
The reference to the of current request.
member.returns: Returns ReturnValue. Event will be cancelled when ReturnValue is False.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.OnInitializeChildTableDataSource(ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridTable,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Invoked when childTable's dataSource need to be initialized.
member.remarks:
WebGrid was built with scalability and performance as its key design consideration. It is specially designed to work best in enterprise-class environment in which each childTables contains very large dataSource.
WebGrid provides a true "Load On Demand" architecture in which developers has full control over the childTable's dataSource. Developers can decide to load only root level's dataSource on the first page load and then load the childTable's dataSource only on when users click on [+] sign to expand childTable's rows.
You can take advantage of the provided ParentConstraints parameter which is a XML string that contain a pair of constraints and values of the ParentRow; to filter and dynamically load the childTable's dataSource based on the constraints. This enables you to fully control the server's workload and dramatically increases overall performance.
By default, WebGrid is able to handle and load ChildTable's rows automatically based on correct constrains without any additional codes. However, you can choose to override and write your own codes in this event.
member.param: The reference to the object.
The reference to the dataSource object.
The reference to the ParentConstraints.
The reference to the custom request data send by client's request.
member.returns: Returns ReturnValue. Event will be cancelled when ReturnValue is False.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.OnInitializeSelfReferenceDataSource(ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridTable,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Invoked when self reference child requires data source.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.LayoutSettings
member.summary: LayoutSettings is the central object that contain all the behaviors and styles for the whole WebGrid control.
member.remarks:
All Intersoft's component provides a common, centralized object called LayoutSettings. It contains many features that allow you to fully customize each part of the control's look and feel directly at design-time.
The LayoutSettings object can be saved in a file by using method. You can later restore back the LayoutSettings by using method. You can also save your LayoutSettings that is commonly used and apply it to all WebGrid object in either design-time or runtime.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.StateRestorationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the level of control's state restoration. See help for more information.
member.remarks:
This property controls the control's state restoration level which is very important to increase the performance of OnTheFly postback. The default value is High, means that state restoration will be performed as maximum as possible. With this setting, all client's states including static properties and dynamic objects will be sent to server on postback. You should switch to High mode especially when you are creating most of objects at runtime, such as retrieving structure at runtime, setting layoutsetting or setting textsettings at runtime.
The Medium value indicates that dynamic objects such as grouped columns, filtered columns and so on - which can be changed by user interactively - will be sent to server on postback, along with layoutsettings and table properties.
The Low value will sent as minimal state as possible to server. Only dynamic objects and important values that vital to the control are being sent and therefore this mode will increase the speed of OnTheFly postback dramatically. This mode is very suitable for grid that created in design time and that most settings are specified in design time. Most developers preferred the best practice that is to take advantage of IDE design time capability to save time with less codes, such as retrieving hierarchical structure, setting grid's behavior, table properties and column properties. We recommended to switch to this level for maximum performance, which usually is 50% faster than High level restoration especially noticed when used in Internet zone application. Note that this mode will still work perfectly with all UI features and functionalities.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.AllowAutoDataCaching
member.summary: Specifies whether data caching is automatically handled by the control.
member.remarks:
This property enables the automatic caching of assigned DataSource object. Always leave this property to True as it's a powerful and effective approach to reduce server's workload and dramatically increase server response time.
By utilizing the power of .NET caching feature, WebGrid.NET implements advanced datacaching mechanism to reduce server workloads. The scope of the cache is session. This enables a greater and more flexible control to the WebGrid object. The WebGrid control keeps track of each session's cache and will automatically remove the DataSource object from cache when it's no longer accessed.
If the DataSource object is a dynamic object -- means that it always been changed or added in less than 5 mins -- you may consider to set this property to False. However, in most cases, leave this property to True will give your users a faster response.
In order to take advantage of this property, you should always use to check whether the DataSource already been cached before you assign a DataSource. See the examples for details.
In some scenarios, you can assign a different DataSource directly from code with just assigning the DataSource property to new datasource. In this case, old cache will be automatically removed and new instance of cache will be created.
Default value is True.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.UseCachedDataOnFirstLoad
member.summary: Specifies whether to use cached data when the page is first loaded.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.DataCacheStorage
member.summary: Specifies where to store the data cache.
member.remarks:
The default value is PageCache. The PageCache data storage implementation is the one implemented in previous version of grid component. This property is only taken affect when AllowAutoDataCaching property is set to True (by default).
The new Session data storage mode enables better datasource persistent mechanism when information is more scoped per user's session. With this mode, datasource's cache will be valid as long as the session hasn't expired.
The default PageCache storage mode is sufficient and effective for most development scenarios. Following describes the behavior of both modes:
PageCache
Stored in ASP.NET's built-in Cache object.
Expiring in a time period, default is 15 minutes.
Use SetCacheControl() method to control cache's time and priority.
Requires implementation of InitializeDataSource event to taken affect effectively.
Best used for scenarios when all level of data can be retrieved once together.
Session
Stored in Session object.
Expiring when session is timed out or Session.Abandon() method is called. To longer the cache time, simply increase the Session's timeout value.
Doesn't require implementation of InitializeDataSource event. Work perfectly with common databinding method using DataBind() in Page_Load event. However, databinding implementation using InitializeDataSource event is more recommended for centralized and standarization in control's binding mechanism.
Best used for scenarios when data is scoped based per user/session and when on demand data retrieval implementation is required for multiple level of childtables.
Better performance, the control will only hit the database for first page load and use the cached data for entire session - unlike PageCache which will need to renew the data in a time period.
Better scalability, you can implement SqlServer mode for storing the Session's data for larger applications that work in WebFarm or clustering.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.IsFlyPostBack
member.summary: Returns whether this WebGrid instance invokes OnTheFly postback.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.FlyPostBackSettings
member.summary: Configures the settings used by the control when performing OnTheFly postback.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGrid.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for which the WebGrid control displays its data.
member.remarks:
WebGrid accepts most of DataSource type introduced in Microsoft .NET such as DataView, DataTable or DataSet objects. You can also assign SqlDataReader, OleDbDataReader and any objects that implements IList interface. You can even use XML data or custom data class as DataSource.
One of WebGrid's key design is its ability to assign most of .NET data objects as DataSource while keeping all features to work perfectly. Unlike other controls, WebGrid's key feature such as automatic grouping, sorting, filtering and "LoadOnDemand" architecture will still work perfectly and automatically when you assign non-DataSet-based object.
WebGrid's advanced data caching mechanism will also work when you assigned non-DataSet-based objects. This enables the consistency and application of all WebGrid's key features in all DataSource type.
However, although WebGrid supports most of .NET data objects, it is always the best practice to use DataSet-based object as DataSet architecture provides many advanced functionalities such as data relations which is the key design of WebGrid's Hieararchical implementation.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridRow.ExpandChildRow
member.summary: Expand child rows of this row.
member.remarks:
Use this method to make this row shown in expanded mode. All childtable's rows will be retrieved and shown as well. Note that this method will not have any affect when the row's ChildNotExpandable property is set to True or when the Table where this row belongs to doesn't have any childtables defined.
When OnInitializeChildTableDataSource event is implemented for on-demand data retrieving, this method will automatically call the event when necessary. Therefore, the existing implementation can still be used and wouldn't cause any conflicts.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridRow.FillChildRow
member.summary: Populates the child rows of each child tables contained in the that own this row.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridRow.ExpandSelfRefRow
member.summary: Expand this self referencing row.
member.remarks: When the expanded self referencing row is down beyond a few levels, all parent levels will be expanded automatically for consistency.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridRow.ExpandSelfRefRow(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Expand self referencing row and force the child rows to be filled and rendered eventhough LoadOnDemand is set to True.
member.param: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the child rows should be populated when LoadOnDemand is used.
member.remarks: Normally when LoadOnDemand is set to True, the grid will not populate the child rows and hence the child rows would never be rendered. The child rows will be loaded on demand when users clicked on the Expand icon, which will executing developers code written in OnInitializeSelfReferenceDataSource event. However for some advanced scenarios, developers might want to preload the selfref's childrows in server side eventhough LoadOnDemand is set to True. Developers can now use this method to achieve this scenario. This method enables the best of both worlds, allowing specific child rows preloading while other rows will be loaded on demand only when users request it.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle
member.summary: The WebGridFormatStyle class handles properties and methods directly related to the appearance of an object inside the grid. WebGridFormatStyles are applied to the cells, footers and column headers of the grid.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether a object is set to Nothing or Null.

remarks.p: True if the WebGridFormatStyle object from which this method was invoked is set to Nothing or Null; otherwise, False.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle.IsStyleEmpty
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether a object is set to Nothing or Null.

remarks.p: True if the WebGridFormatStyle object from which this method was invoked is set to Nothing or Null; otherwise, False.

The difference between this method and IsEmpty method is this method will only check available styles, and not including the CssClass property. This allow the style engine to determine whether multiple class name can be automatically generated to support better style cascading for objects.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the WebGridFormatStyle class to their default values.
The "ShouldSerialize" properties of the WebGridFormatStyle will retun False until set again.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle.CopyFrom(System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style)
member.summary: Duplicates the style properties of the specified Style into the instance of the Style class from which this method is invoked.

remarks.p: Use the CopyFrom method to duplicate the style properties of the specified Style into the instance of the Style class from which this method is invoked.
All properties in the current instance of the Style class will be replaced by their corresponding properties in the Style specified by the style parameter.

param.name: style
param.p: A Style object that represents the style to copy.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle.MergeWith(ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle,System.String)
member.summary: Merges the style with the 'mergeStyle' style using 'styles' as the array of styles to merge separated with semicolon. Empty means CustomRules.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFormatStyle.Wrap
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the text associated with a object is wrapped.

remarks.p: Set this property to True when the text associated with the WebGridFormatStyle object should wrap from one line to the next when it does not fit.
Set this property to False (default) when the text associated the WebGridFormatStyle object should not wrap.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartTextureMappingStyle
member.summary: Controls how texture based fillings are mapped on the object

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartTextureMappingStyle.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to fill the parts of the object not covered by the texture.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartTextureMappingStyle.HorizontalScale
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional scale in the X dimension to be applied to the texture when mapped.
member.remarks: The default value is 1.0f meaning no additional scaling.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartTextureMappingStyle.MapLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls how the texture is positioned relative to the object.
member.remarks: The most commonly used layout types are MapLayout.Stretched and MapLayout.Tiled.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartTextureMappingStyle.MapMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls the mapping mode used by the drawing engine.
member.remarks: There are three mapping types, but you'll most likely use only the relative to object mapping type (MapMode.RelativeToObject) where texture coordinates are computed relatively to the object position.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartTextureMappingStyle.VerticalScale
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional scale in the Y dimension to be applied to the texture when mapped.
member.remarks: The default value is 1.0f meaning no additional scaling.

member.summary: Controls the appearance of titles that appear on the axis

member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the axis title

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartScaleTitleStyle.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specfies the offset of the title from the labels in the scale.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartScaleTitleStyle.RulerAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the title relative to the axis ruler.

member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the label from it's anchor point on the axis ruler.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the axis title

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle
member.summary: Represents the appearance styles, which defines the backplane of an object

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle.EdgePercent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls the edge size of the smooth edge or cut edge rectangle.
member.remarks: The Style property must be set to SmoothEdgeRectangle or SmoothEdgeRectangle. The property specifies the percentage of the edge occupied by the smooth edge of cut edge in percents of the backplane width or height depending on which one of them is smaller. The default value is 20%.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle.FillStyle
member.summary: Gets the object that controls the fill effect applied on the backplane.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle.Inflate
member.summary: Gets the object that controls the inflates dimension for the backplane width and height in pixels.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle.ShadowStyle
member.summary: Gets the object that controls the backplane shadow.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets a value defining the style of the backplane.
member.remarks: The possible values are: Rectangle, Ellipse, Circle, CutEdgeRectangle and SmoothEdgeRectangle. In the case of CutEdgeRectangle and SmoothEdgeRectangle you can also control the percentage of the edge relative to the width or height of the backplane (whichever one is smaller).

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle.StandardFrameStyle
member.summary: Gets the object that controls the standard backplane frame.
member.remarks: This type of frame resembles the standard Windows frames and can show all types of frames specified by the style of the window (raised, sunken, single etc).

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartBackplaneStyle.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls the visibility of the back plane.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value defining the format string for the legend texts.

member.summary: Gets the object defining the text style used to display the series legend entries.

member.summary: Controls settings related to the chart rendering and scaling like antialiasing, jittering and 2D object scaling.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartVisualEffectSettings.EnableJittering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the jittering (full context antialiasing) feature of the control is enabled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of image samples rendered by the control to produce a jittered image.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicates whether or not to render the chart to a bitmap or use a double buffer window.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartVisualEffectSettings.ShapeRenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls the antialising (smoothing) feature of the control.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartVisualEffectSettings.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls the text rendering hint (antialising) applied to text in the control.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartLightModelSettings
member.summary: Controls the light effects applied to a 3D scene. It allows you to enable and disable scene lighting, to load predefined light schemes and control global light properties as well as gives access to the collection of light sources.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartLightModelSettings.EnableLighting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether lighting effect is enabled.
member.remarks: When lighting is turned off, all lighting properties (light sources and materials) are discarded and have no effect on the rendered scene. By default the lighting is enabled. You can disable it to increase the rendering performance or in case that lighting effects are not really necessary (for example in 2D charts).

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartLightModelSettings.GlobalAmbientLight
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the color of the global ambient light.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartLightModelSettings.LocalViewpointLighting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether local viewpoint lighting is enabled. The local viewpoint lighting controls the way OpenGL calculates specular reflection angles.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartLightModelSettings.LightSources
member.summary: Gets the object that represents the collection of light sources that are applied to the scene.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartLightModelSettings.LightModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies predefined light model.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridTable
member.summary: WebGridTable is the central object of WebGrid control. It is used as the object that represents the top most level of object.
member.remarks:
WebGridTable consists of and which are primary objects that is used to render a WebGrid control. WebGridTable can also contain multiple WebGridTable objects contained in which is used to represent hierarchical grid.
WebGridTable contains numerous properties and settings that control the behavior of each WebGridTable independently such as AllowAddNew, AllowColumnMove, AllowSorting, and so on. Developers can either set these properties on design time or runtime. It also contains collection of GroupedColumns, SortedColumns and FilteredColumns in which you can add or remove items on either design time or runtime.
The WebGridTable has built-in methods to retrieve columns and hierarchical childTable's structure based on the assigned DataSource and its DataMember. However, it is always the best practice to have all columns defined at design time as you can customize many appearance and behavior settings of the columns.
Note: It is recommended that WebGridTable's DataMember or Name doesn't contain characters such as space, _ (underscore), - (minus), or other unusual characters.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridTable.AutomaticSort
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to allow WebGrid automatically handle sorting operation.
member.remarks:
By default, WebGrid handles all sorting operation automatically. That means developers don't required to write additional programmatic codes for the sorting operation and hence can focus more on core business logic.
For greater level of customization, developers can choose to turn off AutomaticSort and write their own codes to handle sorting operation through event.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridTable.AutomaticFilter
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to allow WebGrid automatically handle filtering operation.
member.remarks:
By default, WebGrid handles all filtering operation automatically. That means developers don't required to write additional programmatic codes for the filtering operation and hence can focus more on core business logic.
For greater level of customization, developers can choose to turn off AutomaticFilter and write their own codes to handle filtering operation through event.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridTable.GroupTotalVisible
member.summary: Determines whether total row for each GroupRow is shown.
member.remarks:
WebGrid's key strength is its advanced and sophisticated UI elements allowing users to work interactively with the information. WebGrid provides two types of GroupRow's info which both of them can be shown at the same time.
The first type is the row information that appear in the GroupRow's row. Although that you can put most of information such as group's recordcount, sum or average of a column; it is become unfeasible and not readable when you have many columns that need to be calculated.
By turning on GroupTotalVisible, you will be able to see each column's total at the bottom of its position. The GroupTotalRow takes the advantage of WebGrid's AutoLayout as its width will be synchronized as users resize column's width. This result in more readable and better understanding of delivered information.
The GroupTotal will in conjuction with WebGridColumn's . To display Group's total for a column, you need to set how the column will be calculated through AggregateFunction property.

In that scenario, you can set this property to #Name or #Value so that WebGrid will automatically populate the cell based on the tree node's data.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFilterCollection.AdvancedFilterExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the advanced filter expression.
member.remarks:
Use this property to perform more complex filter expression to WebGrid's DataSource. For example, you can now perform filtering on multiple expression on single column such as "(CustomerID LIKE 'A%' OR CustomerID LIKE 'B%')". The filtering expression should comfort the ADO.NET filter expression standard. Note that when you set this property, any WebGridFilter objects contained in this collection will be ignored.
This property will be set automatically when Advanced Filtering is applied from Customize View client-side UI.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle
member.summary: Controls the line (or border) parameters of the object it is applied to. With the properties of this object you can modify the line style, color and width.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the alignment of a Pen object in relation to the theoretical, zero-width line.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the line color.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.DashCap
member.summary: Gets or sets the cap style used at the end of the dashes drawn with this stroke style.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.EndCap
member.summary: Gets or sets the cap style used at the end of lines drawn with this stroke style.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.Factor
member.summary: Gets or sets a multiplier for each bit in the line stipple pattern.
member.remarks: The Pattern and Factor properties define the line by working together to define whether a certain pixel from the line should be drawn or not. If factor is 3, for example, each bit in the pattern will be used three times before the next bit in the pattern is used. The factor parameter is clamped to the range [1, 256] and defaults to one. The values of the LinePattern enumeration actually represent 16-bit integers whose bit pattern determines which fragments of a line will be drawn when the line is rasterized.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.LineJoin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how to join consecutive line or curve segments in a figure (subpath) contained in a GraphicsPath object.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.Pattern
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the line pattern.
member.remarks: The Pattern and Factor properties define the line by working together to define whether a certain pixel from the line should be drawn or not. The values of the LinePattern enumeration actually represent 16-bit integers whose bit pattern determines which fragments of a line will be drawn when the line is rasterized. Bit zero is used first. For example the value of SolidLine is all ones (0xFFFF). You can create you own patterns by simply setting the bits of the short integer value that you want the line to draw. Suppose for example that you want to draw a line having three empty pixels, then one black then three empty and so forth. The value you should pass to the LinePattern in this case is 0x8888 or in binary 1000100010001000. You must also set the Factor property to 1.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.StartCap
member.summary: Gets or sets the cap style used at the beginning of lines drawn with this stroke style

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.ChartStrokeStyle.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls the width of the lines in format.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridColumn
member.summary: Represents a column of data that belongs to a WebGridTable object.
member.remarks:
WebGridColumn provides several which allow you to display rich information that contains images, images and text, and so on.
WebGridColumn can work in Bound or Unbound mode in a DataBound WebGrid. It can also be added or removed dynamically at runtime. The modification of WebGridColumnCollection object is recommended to be write in event. The concept is to centralize all your layout-related codes to be in one function for better readability, easier maintainance and debugging.
WebGridColumn object has been designed to be as flexible as possible to meet many business requirements. You can write your own custom content that contains rich HTML by setting the ColumnType to Custom. You write the custom content codes in event on when a row is about to be rendered.
By default, the property is set to False for more consistent layout. In this case, WebGrid will automatically truncate the cell's text and add ellipsis (...) in the right most of the cell's text. It will also automatically popup a tooltip of the complete cell's text when the mouse is over the truncated cell. You can turn the AllowMultiLine property to True if your data contains ENTER or other linebreak characters.
The WebGridColumn is also featured with a set of functions which is used to calculate and display column's its result in GroupTotalRow and Table's Footer.
WebGridColumn also provides the mechanism for value to text translation through property. Developers can now easily display different data instead of its value that is more readable and useful by assigning the ValueList property with object that has been properly constructed.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridColumn.SortKeyField
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort key field for SortColumn.
member.remarks:
This property is designed to be used for SortColumn only. Generally, you can leave this property to blank when the SortColumn's ColumnMember is the field that you want to sort. In many scenarios, you may want to sort other key field while the ColumnMember is a field which translated by ValueList such as EmployeeID. One of the most implemented scenario is where you used ValueList to translate the EmployeeID into a useful information such as EmployeeName and you also want to sort the data by EmployeeName instead of the EmployeeID when user clicked on the EmployeeID column. In this context, you can simply set the SortKeyField of the WebGridColumn to EmployeeName and the built-in sorting operation will use the specified WebGridColumn's SortKeyField property instead of the ColumnMember's DataMember.
Note: Make sure that the SortKeyField is available in your DataSource. It is not necessary to add the SortKeyField in WebGridColumnCollection.

member.summary: Specifies the default text of this column when new row is added.
member.remarks: DefaultText property is used in conjuction with column which EditType is DropDownList or WebComboNET. Since that these edit types can contain different value for its displayed Text and cell value, this property can be used to contain the displayed Text part while the DefaultValue will be used as the default cell's value. Note that you don't need to set this property for other edit types such as TextBox, as the DefaultValue property will be used.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridColumn.IsRowChecker
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this column should act as row checker.
member.remarks: When set to True, the ColumnType will be automatically set to Checkbox, EditType to NoEdit, ShowInSelectColumns to False. The difference between row checker with other checkbox column is that row checker will mark the entire row of checked checkbox with CheckedRowStyle. Furthermore, the checked rows will be passed to server during both OnTheFly and full page postback for server-side programmability. Note that only 1 RowChecker is valid per table.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridColumn.IsAutoWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this column is an auto width column.
member.remarks: When set to True, this column will be expanded or shrinked to fit into grid's width, leaving all other columns' width untouched. This property will only take affect when AutoFitColumns property is set to True. This property doesn't take affect in ColumnSet rowlayout mode. Note that only 1 AutoWidth column is valid per table.

member.summary: Indicates whether the value list data should be used for sorting a column.
member.remarks:
By default, this property will inherit the value of UseValueListForSorting property defined in WebGridTable level unless this property is modified to specific value other than Default.
When set to Yes, the text field of the value list will be used to sort a column instead of the original data in the column. This feature makes it easy for developers to automatically perform column sorting based on data text field defined in the value list.

member.remarks: LayoutSet contains numerous Styles that control the appearance of the WebGrid. You can customize all parts of the WebGrid's UI Element to best suit your application's needs. You can easily set the styles in design-time without any knowledge needed in DHTML, Scripts or CSS syntax.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.VirtualPageSize
member.summary: Specify the number of rows to retrieve when is set to VirtualLoad.
member.remarks:
One of WebGrid's key feature is its ability to retrieve data on demand. This property work in conjunction when is set to VirtualLoad. The VirtualLoad feature enables the control to transparently retrieve more data that defined in this property as users scroll forward.
VirtualLoad paging mode is designed to work best in large DataSource web applications with performance as its key design consideration.
Default value is 50.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.PagingMode
member.summary: Specified the paging mode that control the rows retrieval behavior in WebGrid.
member.remarks:
WebGrid introduces a new concept in DataGrid paging that allow users to retrieve data when it is needed. The feature called 'VirtualLoad' enables true data "load on demand" mechanism which automatically retrieves data as users scroll forward. The new concept has replaced the old data paging mechanism in web applications that use navigation bar which is less effective since that there is need to refresh page in order to get more data and become unfeasible when data grows larger as business growth.
The implementation of the new paging concept - VirtualLoad - provides an effective approach for users as more data will retrieved from server transparently. WebGrid will initially loads a number of rows specified in . This results in faster page rendering to client, less bandwith taken and reduced server's workload. Integrated with Intersoft(r) WebCommonControl architecture that allow data to be retrieved without page postback has fully support the feature to work perfectly in web-based environment. The combination of the VirtualLoad feature and WebCommonControl architecture resulting in a major performance improvement since that the architecture uses its own ViewState implementation that only send required information to server and only pass back the UI elements that need to be rendered.
The key design of the feature is to enable a fast, effective and efficient data presentation when work in large DataSource's web applications. Developers are recommended to turn on VirtualLoad paging mode most of the times.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.Hierarchical
member.summary: Specifies whether or not WebGrid will display hierarchical data.
member.remarks:
Sets the Hierarchical to True, to display hierarchical data from your DataSource. WebGrid has been simplified so that you only need to change this property to switch between Flat or Hierarchical data display. When set to True, WebGrid will automatically renders the Hierarchical elements and automatically load the data source when needed.
WebGrid's Hierarchical feature is built with performance, efficiency and scalability as its key design. On first time the page load, only DataSource is processed. When users click on [+] (expand) sign which is an icon representation in left most of a record, the control will automatically and transparently load the childTable's contents. This enables a superior performance when interact with information and large datasets.
For much greater control of loading childTable's dataSource, WebGrid provides event, allow you to control the data retrieval codes by using the given parentConstraints parameter. This enables the use of WebGrid in large enterprise web applications such as call center, CRM or ERP.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.AlwaysShowHelpButton
member.summary: Specifies whether Help button is always shown in WebGrid UI.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.NewRowLostFocusAction
member.summary: Specifies the action when the New Row has lose its focus while the contained cells has been changed.
member.remarks:
The action specified in this property will take affect when the cells has been edited/changed and meet the following conditions:
Users change the row's selection by using mouse (clicking other row in the grid).
Users change the row's selection by using keyboard (navigating to other row by using down or up arrow).
Users perform one of the data request actions which require display refresh, such as grouping, ungrouping or clicking on Refresh icon.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.RowLostFocusAction
member.summary: Specifies the action when the row has lose its focus while the contained cells has been changed.
member.remarks:
The action specified in this property will take affect when the cells has been edited/changed and meet the following conditions:
Users change the row's selection by using mouse (clicking other row in the grid).
Users change the row's selection by using keyboard (navigating to other row by using down or up arrow).
Users perform one of the data request actions which require display refresh, such as grouping, ungrouping or clicking on Refresh icon.
Users click on RowSelector to select entire row.
Users click on Expand icon to display child rows of specified row.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.TextSettings
member.summary: This property provides convenient way to change textual settings used in WebGrid.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.AllowExport
member.summary: Specifies a value whether grid export is allowed in UI.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ChildRowEmptyAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the action when loaded child table is empty (no rows).

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.AlwaysUseCachedDataOnFirstLoad
member.summary: Specifies whether the cached data source will always be used on first page load.
member.remarks: When set to True, InitializeDataSource event will not be fired even on first page load if the DataSource is still in cache. Set this property to True will improve the performance significantly and is highly recommended for page that display static/unconditional data, such as all customers data. For page that displays grid data based on a condition or criteria, it is best to set this property to False.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.CustomFilterString
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom filtering string.
member.remarks: This property allow developers to assign additional or global filters to the DataSource instead of the built-in FilterColumns.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ResetNewRowValuesOnError
member.summary: Determines whether cells value of NewRow should be reinitialized when an error occurred during AddRow server event.
member.remarks: This setting is only taken affect when the new row editing was ended in normal context, such as by pressing shift+enter or tabbing until the last editable cell. This behavior doesn't affect when the new row editing was ended because other row or cell is clicked. You should use OnRowValidate client side event to implement validation and return false to prevent ending edit mode. When the validation failed (by returning false), the new row and the cell which cause the validation to fail will get focused automatically.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.InProgressUIBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the user interface behavior when a request is in progress.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ColumnSetHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether the columnset's headers is visible or not.

member.summary: The style applied to preview row area.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.CheckedRowStyle

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.QuickFilterBarStyle

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.SortedColumnStyle

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.RowHeaderStyle

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.TreeLines
member.summary: Specifies whether the tree lines is shown for Hierarchical mode.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ChildTableSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing width between each child table in the same level.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.HyperlinkStyle
member.summary: The style used for hyperlink column type.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ShowRefreshButton
member.summary: Specifies whether the grid should display Refresh button in status bar.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.AutoFitColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all displayed columns's width should be fitted to grid.
member.remarks:
AutoFitColumns work in 2 modes:
Proportional width mode. In this mode, all columns' width will be calculated proportionally to fit into the grid. This mode will be used by default when no AutoWidth column is specified.
AutoWidth column mode. In this mode, only the column which IsAutoWidth set to true will be expanded or shrinked to fit into the grid. Other columns' width will be leave unmodified. However, when the width of the AutoWidth column is less than the number specified in AutoColMinWidth, the AutoWidth Column will be set to AutoColMinWidth and other columns' width will be calculated proportionally in order to fit into grid.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.AutoFitColumnsBuffering
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the automatic column width calculation should be buffered.
member.remarks: The recommended value for this property is True. When buffered, the width calculation will be smoother during page load and hence avoiding screen flicking. This property is used in conjunction with AutoFitColumns property.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.FilterBarVisible
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the filter bar will be visible initially.
member.remarks: When this property is set to False, the filter bar will not be visible even though AllowFiltering is set to True. In order to make the filter bar visible, end users can right click in the column header and click on "Filter Bar" menu item.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ClientVisible
member.summary: Specifies a value indicating grid's visibility in client side.
member.remarks: ClientVisible property doesn't affect Visible property and the grid will still be rendered as usual regardless of this property's value. When set to False, the grid will simply not visible although it is rendered. You can easily use client side API to make it visible or hidden dynamically.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.AutoColMinWidth
member.summary: The minimum width for WebGridColumn which IsAutoWidth is set to true.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ScrollBarStyle
member.summary: The style of the grid's scrollbar.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.PromptBeforeDelete
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to display a confirmation box before deleting a row.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ApplyFiltersKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the key used to apply all filters.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.MenuCssFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS file used to control the appearance of context menu. The property should only contains the file name. The location of the file resides in the same folder as ScriptFolder.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.StatusBarCommandStyle
member.summary: The normal, hover and active style for the command item in status bar.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.HelpURL
member.summary: Specifies the client's help URL when user clicked on the Help icon. This property is application-wide configurable.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.PersistRowChecker
member.summary: Specifies whether the grid should persist the rows' RowChecker state during OnTheFly postback and full postback.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.UseRelativePositioning
member.summary: Specifies whether the Grid should use relative positioning. Enable this setting if the Grid is contained within complex container.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.HierarchicalMode
member.summary: Specifies the operation mode when the WebGrid is configured to use Hierarchical feature.
member.remarks: This is a new feature in WebGrid.NET Enterprise 5.0.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.AutoFilterSuggestion
member.summary: Specifies whether a list of suggested filters based on current selection should be added to the context menu.
member.remarks: When set to True, automatic filter suggestion will be added to Column's and Cell's context menu. This feature will boost users productivity by allowing them to quickly perform filter based on the current selected cell data.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.ShowFilterStatus
member.summary: Specifies whether current filter status should be displayed in Grid's status bar.
member.remarks: When set to True, the status bar will show an indicator for the current state of filters. This feature allow users to easily determine the current state of data, as well as easily toggle the filter state.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.LayoutSet.PagingDetectPartialGroupRows
member.summary: Determines whether WebGrid should detect partial group rows when PagingMode is set to ClassicPaging.
member.remarks: When this property is enabled, WebGrid will display the status of the partially rendered group rows such as current position of the group row, the visible count as well as the total rows available in the group.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents
member.summary: Provides a centralized class for client side events.

member.name: M:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor for the ClientEvents object.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnBeforeRequest
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when request action to server is about to be made.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond when request action to server is about to be made. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoBeforeReq".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.action
The action name of the request.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.
Complete action list is as following:
More - Load more data is requested by users.
LoadGroup - Load group data.
ColumnSort - Column sorting.
Group - Column group.
Ungroup - Column ungroup.
ChangeGroup - Column group order changed.
ColumnFilter - Column filtering.
LoadChild - Load child table's contents.
ColumnChange - Column's visibility is changed.
Refresh - Refresh data source.
Custom - Custom actions.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnResponse
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when a response from server is returned.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond when the response from server is returned. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoResponse".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.status
The status of the response.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.
The status of the response will be either "Ok" or "Error".

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnColumnMove
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when a column is being moved.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond when the a column is being moved. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoMoveColumn".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The Table's Name of the column being moved.sourceIndex
The source column's cellIndex.targetIndex
The target column's cellIndex.sourceColumn
The source column's client object.targetColumn
The target column's client object.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnColumnResize
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when a column is being resized.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond when the a column is being resized. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoResizeColumn".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The Table's Name of the column being resized.columnObject
The resized column's object.width
The new column's width.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnColumnChanged
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when a column is changed. Columns changed means that it is being removed or added directly from WebGrid client UI.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond when the a column is changed. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoChangeColumn".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The Table's Name of the column being changed.colName
The column's name.action
The action name. It can be "Removed" or "Added"
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnRowSelect
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when a row is selected.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond when the a row is selected. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoRowSelect".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The Table's Name of the selected row.rowIndex
The selected row's index.rowEl
The selected row's element.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnCellSelect

The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The Table's Name of the selected cell.rowIndex
The selected cell's rowIndex.cellIndex
The selected cell's cellIndex.cellElement

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnCellClick
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when a cell is clicked.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond when the a cell is clicked. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoCellClick".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The Table's Name of the clicked cell.rowIndex
The clicked cell's rowIndex.cellIndex
The clicked cell's cellIndex.cellEl
The clicked cell's element.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.
The difference between CellClick and CellSelect is that CellClick will be invoked regardless of the Table's or Layout's setting for CellClickAction. CellSelect will only invoked when CellClickAction is set to CellSelect.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnButtonClick
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when button cell is clicked.
member.remarks:
The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "HandleEvent". This event allow developers to easily capture the button click event and process implementation further. Button ColumnType now has ability to perform postback to server automatically by setting the ButtonAutoPostBack to True. You can even choose whether the postback would be performed using OnTheFly(tm) postback for fast response or FullPageRefresh. This setting can be found in ButtonPostBackMode property. When ButtonAutoPostback is set to True, the ButtonClick server event will be invoked as well for both PostBackMode. You can cancel postback to occur by setting the return to false in this event.
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The table name of the clicked button.colName
The column name of the clicked button.cellValue
The button cell's value. This value is available for Bound column and DataMember is specified.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnCheckBoxClick
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked when checkbox is clicked.
member.remarks:
The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "HandleEvent".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The table name of the clicked checkbox.colName
The column name of the clicked checkbox.checkboxValue
The value of the checkbox (true if checked).
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnActionDispatched
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked after an FlyPostBack action is dispacthed during response.
member.remarks:
The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "HandleEvent".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.action
The action name of the processed request.
This event is invoked exactly after OnResponse client side event. The difference with OnResponse is that this event is fired only after a successful response, while OnResponse is invoked regardless of whether the response is success or fail (error). Developer is recommended to use this event to perform additional task after an action of response has been retrieved with success state.
This event is invoked before the actual default process handling of the action. If you would like to perform additional tasks after the default process handling then you're recommeded to use OnAfterResponseProcess client side event.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnBeforeRowSelect
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked before a row is selected.
member.remarks:
You can specify user-defined Javascript function to respond before a row is selected. The user-defined function should only contain the name of the function. For example, "DoBeforeRowSelect".
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.tblName
The Table's Name of the selected row.lastSelectedObject
The last selected object before the target row is set as current.
Note that you should include the return value of your function. Returning a true value means that default behavior will be processed. Otherwise, the default behavior will be skipped.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnBeforePrint
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked before the Grid is printed from browser Print menu.
member.remarks:
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.ClientEvents.OnAfterPrint
member.summary: Specifies the client side (JavaScript) function that will be invoked after the Grid is printed from browser Print menu.
member.remarks:
The function can be defined in either inline or linked JavaScript files and can accept following parameters: gridId
The ID of the grid calling the function.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.SeriesSmoothLine
member.summary: Controls series smooth line representation.

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.SeriesSmoothLine.Use1DInterpolationForXYScatter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value controling the interpolation method for XY scatter smooth line charts.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, the y values will be regarded as a function of the x values, which means that there will be only one y value for every x coordinate. If the property is set to false, the line will be regarded as a free curve in the XY plane.

member.summary: The cursor that appears when an application starts.

member.summary: The arrow cursor.

member.summary: The crosshair cursor.

member.summary: The hand cursor, typically used when hovering over a Web link.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.Help
member.summary: The Help cursor, which is a combination of an arrow and a question mark.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.HSplit
member.summary: The cursor that appears when the mouse is positioned over a horizontal splitter bar.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.IBeam
member.summary: The I-beam cursor, which is used to show where the text cursor appears when the mouse is clicked.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.No
member.summary: The cursor that indicates that a particular region is invalid for the current operation.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.NoMove2D
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is not moving, but the window can be scrolled in both a horizontal and vertical direction.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.NoMoveHoriz
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is not moving, but the window can be scrolled in a horizontal direction.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.NoMoveVert
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is not moving, but the window can be scrolled in a vertical direction.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally to the right.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.PanNE
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally and vertically upward and to the right.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling vertically in an upward direction.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.PanNW
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally and vertically upward and to the left.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.PanSE
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally and vertically downward and to the right.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.PanSouth
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling vertically in a downward direction.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.PanSW
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally and vertically downward and to the left.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.CursorType.PanWest
member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally to the left.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapMode
member.summary: Defines how textures are mapped on the surfaces of an object.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapMode.RelativeToObject
member.summary: Mapping is relative to the object. A mapping layout can be specified.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapMode.RelativeToViewer
member.summary: Mapping is relative to the viewer.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapMode.Sphere
member.summary: Environmental mapping used for special visual effects like reflection.

member.name: T:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout
member.summary: The layout used when mapping a texture on an object in the 3D scene.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout.Stretched
member.summary: Stretches the texture along the X and Y axes until it fits the object. It does not preserve the original texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout.Fitted
member.summary: Stretches the texture until its smaller dimension fits the object. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout.Centered
member.summary: Similar to fitted. When used on the background object it also preserves the real original texture dimensions.

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout.Tiled
member.summary: Repeats the texture along the X and Y axes. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout.StretchedToWidth
member.summary: Stretches the texture by width until it fits. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout.StretchedToHeight
member.summary: Stretches the texture by height until it fits. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.Chart.MapLayout.CropFitted
member.summary: Stretches the texture until its larger dimension fits the object. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: P:ISNet.WebUI.WebGrid.WebGridFreezePaneSettings.ShowInContextMenu
